channel.title: ~ Tribute Compiler v1.0 - UNIVERSIAL COMPILER - JAVAC FIXED! ~
channel.description:
This is as close as possible for what you guys want at the moment. I'm on a time crunch, so I had to whip this up a bit fast.
[b] [size=16pt]TRIBUTE COMPILER v1.0[/size][/b]
[color=purple][size=13pt]Tribute Compiler is a universal compiler that works around the majority of all server and client types. This is meant mainly for servers, but has client environment applications as well. This is free, and can be considered open source. But all I give is but one rule: [b]DO NOT[/b] sell this for your own personal profit. This is free software that I have created and taken time to do so. Time and effort has been put into this. Thank you in advance to those who will download. NOTE: This compiler is meant to fix the javac recognition problem![/size][/color]
[b]DOWNLOAD LINK:[/b] http://uppit.com/v/LNLOG4B7
[b]MIRROR 1:[/b] http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?h2inyjmmong

item.title: ~ Tribute Compiler v1.0 - UNIVERSIAL COMPILER - JAVAC FIXED! ~
item.dc:creator: @Sir_Schmoopy Sir Schmoopy
item.description:
@Sir_Schmoopy wrote:

echo c - Compile (Quick 'n' Easy) echo r - Run your server (You probably leeched it) echo i - Installs a basic version of JDK for you echo t - Enter this to get to the Tribute CMDLINE echo e - Exit (Only if you're a wuss to my remarks)
[/quote]

Well Its more than a compiler. Its universal, but it also includes an integrated and quick JDK installation along with a fix (which is still being development, only released in this version as beta) for the javac recognition problem.
I was just showing them what it had in it. :O
brian9612:

thanks man but downloading is 15 mins

It has the latest jdk update included.

Read full topic
item.source: ~ Tribute Compiler v1.0 - UNIVERSIAL COMPILER - JAVAC FIXED! ~

item.title: ~ Tribute Compiler v1.0 - UNIVERSIAL COMPILER - JAVAC FIXED! ~
item.dc:creator: @fatwallet fatwallet
item.description:
@fatwallet wrote:

Yes, this is actually in beta stage, and I have tested it’s compilation/running/other features on a deltascape source, and it has run fine. The code itself is about 80% complete. And this compiler is meant to fix all those problems with “javac is not recognized as an internal or external command”. Thank you for your feedback![br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 09, 2009, 04:54:45 am[/size][hr][quote=“Sir Schmoopy, post:4, topic:287791”]It’s just a compiler/runner.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 08, 2009, 10:09:18 pm[/size][hr]

echo c - Compile (Quick 'n' Easy) echo r - Run your server (You probably leeched it) echo i - Installs a basic version of JDK for you echo t - Enter this to get to the Tribute CMDLINE echo e - Exit (Only if you're a wuss to my remarks) [/quote]

Well Its more than a compiler. Its universal, but it also includes an integrated and quick JDK installation along with a fix (which is still being development, only released in this version as beta) for the javac recognition problem.

Read full topic
item.source: ~ Tribute Compiler v1.0 - UNIVERSIAL COMPILER - JAVAC FIXED! ~

item.title: ~ Tribute Compiler v1.0 - UNIVERSIAL COMPILER - JAVAC FIXED! ~
item.dc:creator: @xxDiluted2xx xxDiluted2xx
item.description:
@xxDiluted2xx wrote:

This will probably be usefull for many people. An all-purpose compiler is what you’re trying to say? Yes, useful indeed. This IS worth downloading. I wouldn’t see why anyone wouldn’t. I think people are trying to find ways to compile WITHOUT Java. But that seems… Yeah. I wouldn’t know either. Thanks for making this, it’s worth rep++.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 09, 2009, 12:40:35 am[/size][hr]By the way, my download is 18%, and the size is this big. ‘73.16 MB’. Is it a fricking client or something? That’s pretty big for a compiler. <_<

Read full topic
